newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso mixed as market tracks U.S. long bond.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso mixed as market tracks U.S. long bond.

text.p: The Mexican peso was mixed at midmorning Friday, showing some improvement from earlier in the day, as yields moderated on the U.S. long bond, dealers said.
"Some banks have gradually been shedding dollars, probably to get a good rate in pesos before any further recovery," a dealer said.
The benchmark 48-hour peso stood 0.3 of a peso firmer at 7.7580/7.7620 while its 24-hour counterpart was 0.5 of a centavo softer at 7.7550/7.7600 per dollar.
Same-day peso contracts had closed 0.75 of a centavo firmer at 7.7490/7.7520 per dollar.
The U.S. 30-year Treasury bond had pared its early losses and was down 11/32, with yield up to 6.58 percent.
